Comment: Meeting in Recess - Continuation of Recessed Meeting of May 23, 2018 HELD on June 7, 2018

Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION  - Delivered by: Michael Vanacore, Minister for Congregational Life & Social Justice, Trinity Lutheran Church in Sunset Park, 411 46th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11220.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Menchaca.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Michael Vanacore, Minister for Congregational Life & Social Justice, Trinity Lutheran Church in Sunset Park, 411 46th Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11220.

Council Member Menchaca moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 25,2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Ampry-Samuel.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Ampry-Samuel moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 25, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor – Submitting Executive Order No. 35 of 2018 pursuant to Section 3-113(a)(2) of the New York City Administrative Code, entitled “Deputy Mayors”.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting Executive Order No. 35 of 2018, entitled “Deputy Mayors”.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Items.AgendaNote: COMMUNICATIONS FROM CITY, COUNTY & BOROUGH OFFICES - None

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Powers:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 625 Madison Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community District  5, Council District 4, Application No. 20185408 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 625 Madison Avenue, Manhattan (20185408 TCM)

Items.Title: Application No. C 180063 ZSM submitted by Madison 45 Broad Development LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Sections 91-251 and 74-634 of the Zoning Resolution to allow a floor area bonus on a zoning lot where major improvements to adjacent subway stations are provided in accordance with the provisions of Section 74-634, in connection with a proposed mixed-use development on property located at 45 Broad Street (Block 25, Lots 7 and 10), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 1, Council District 1.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter.
Items.AgendaNote: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Rule 11.70(b) of the Rules of the Council and Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Rule 11.70(b) of the Rules of the Council and Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 45 Broad St, Manhattan (C 180063 ZSM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON MENTAL HEALTH, DISABILITIES AND ADDICTION

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit to the council reports relating to opioid antagonists
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to submit to the council reports relating to opioid antagonists.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to distributing educational materials on drugs and opiates awareness and prevention to middle and high school students
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Distributing educational materials on drugs and opiates awareness and prevention to junior high and high school students.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to include drug awareness education concerning opioids in the school curriculum.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: DOE to include drug awareness education concerning opioids in the school curriculum.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to syringe exchange programs
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Syringe exchange programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the fire department to submit to the council reports relating to the administration of opioid antagonists
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the fire dept to submit to the council reports relating to the administration of opioid antagonists.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the municipal drug strategy advisory council to report on opioid antagonist distribution
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the municipal drug strategy advisory council to report on opioid antagonist distribution.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to overdose prevention and reversal training
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Overdose prevention and reversal training.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of social services and the department of homeless services to refer individuals receiving opioid antagonists for additional services
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of social services and the dept of homeless services to refer individuals receiving opioid antagonists for additional services.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, relation to amending sex designation on birth records and the issuance of birth records
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Amending sex designation on birth records and the issuance of birth records.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Homeless Services to report information regarding veterans entering and exiting shelter
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Department of Homeless Services to report information regarding veterans entering and exiting shelter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to make crime statistics at each New York city housing authority operated housing development available through the department’s website, as well as making other crime information regarding such housing developments available to the city council
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to make crime statistics at each NYCHA operated housing development available through the department’s website, as well as making other crime information regarding such housing developments available to the city council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the replacement of city-owned trees that have been lawfully removed
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Replacement of city-owned trees that have been lawfully removed.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing penalties for unauthorized street hails by licensed for-hire vehicle drivers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
Items.MatterName: Reducing penalties for unauthorized street hails by licensed for-hire vehicle drivers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the zone around the World Trade Center in which food and general vendors are prohibited
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Expanding the zone around the World Trade Center in which food and general vendors are prohibited.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to allowed amount of impermeable area at zoning lots
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Allowed amount of impermeable area at zoning lots.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation air quality monitoring at designated “heavy use” thoroughfares.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Air quality monitoring at designated “heavy use” thoroughfares.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending J-51 benefits to owners of multiple dwellings for sustainable roofing zones
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Extending J-51 benefits to owners of multiple dwellings for sustainable roofing zones.

Items.Title: A Local Law requiring an assessment of the density of development in flood-prone areas in order to determine whether such density interferes with the ability of the inhabitants of such areas to reach safety in response to storms and other natural disasters
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring an assessment of the density of development in flood-prone areas.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to requiring smoke detecting devices and carbon monoxide detecting devices in certain dwellings and common areas
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring smoke detecting devices and carbon monoxide detecting devices in certain dwellings and common areas.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to applications for retail dealer licenses for sale of cigarettes or tobacco products
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Applications for retail dealer licenses for sale of cigarettes or tobacco products.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to commit to an expeditious transition to an electric bus fleet and to use electric buses as a robust part of its replacement service during the upcoming L train shutdown.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Governor & MTA to commit to an expeditious transition to an electric bus fleet and to use electric buses as a robust part of its replacement service during the upcoming L train shutdown.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Hookah paraphernalia advertisements.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to community land trusts
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Community land trusts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of short-term residential rentals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Regulation of short-term residential rentals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to establishing an office of the waterfront
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Establishing an office of the waterfront.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A6640/S7828, A7021, and A7023/S63 in relation to the establishment and funding of the gun research safety fund.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establishment and funding of the gun research safety fund. (A6640/S7828, A7021, and A7023/S63)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a rebuttable presumption that retaliation or discrimination has occurred if a negative employment action occurs within 180 days of a person partaking in a protected activity under the city’s human rights law
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Creating a rebuttable presumption that retaliation or discrimination has occurred if a negative employment action occurs within 180 days of a person partaking in a protected activity under the city’s human rights law.

Items.Title: Resolution to recognize “Meatless Monday” in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Recognize “Meatless Monday” in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to transportation of sewage sludge
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Transportation of sewage sludge

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city police department to implement policies regarding social media
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to implement policies regarding social media.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to make all subway stations in hurricane evacuation zones accessible to people with disabilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to make all subway stations in hurricane evacuation zones accessible to people with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.10091, to prohibit firearms as prizes in any game of chance.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibit firearms as prizes in any game of chance. (A. 10091)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A8134/S6427, which would allow certain New York City agencies to use Design-Build contracts for construction projects.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Allow certain NYC agencies to use Design-Build contracts for construction projects. (A.8134/S.6427)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to denying building permits where a residential building has an excessive number of violations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Denying building permits where a residential building has an excessive number of violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the disclosure in employment advertisements of mandatory arbitration and non-disparagement clauses in employment contracts
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Disclosure in employment advertisements of mandatory arbitration and non-disparagement clauses in employment contracts.

Items.Title: The Public Advocate will call the meeting to order
Items.AgendaNote: The Public Advocate will call the meeting to order
Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) called the Recessed Meeting of May 23, 2018 held on June 7, 2018 to order.

Items.Title: Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum
Items.AgendaNote: The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum
Items.MinutesNote: The Clerk announced the presence of a quorum for the Recessed Meeting.

Items.Title: The Public Advocate will adjourn the recessed meeting
Items.AgendaNote: The Public Advocate will adjourn the recessed meeting
Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned the Recessed Meeting of May 23, 2018 in order to open the Stated Meeting of June 7, 2018.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Savino, S.8497, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10696, “AN  ACT  to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to amending the contribution provisions applicable to  certain  New  York City  Employees' Retirement  System (NYCERS) Special Plans subject to Retirement and Social Security Law (RSSL) Articles 14 and 15 to allow using any excess basic or additional member contributions to offset any deficits in such other contribution account  prior  to  date  of retirement”.
Items.MatterName: Amending the contribution provisions applicable to certain New York City Employees’ Retirement System (NYCERS) Special Plans subject to Retirement and Social Security Law (RSSL) Articles 14 and 15.  (A.10696/ S. 8497)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Holyman and Golden, S.7780, and Assembly Member Gottfried, A.9943, “AN ACT relating to granting retroactive eligibility to apply for enhanced Tier 3 status to former New York City police officer Mark Rivera”.
Items.MatterName: Granting retroactive eligibility to apply for enhanced Tier 3 status to former New York City police officer Mark Rivera. (S.7780/ A.9943)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Peralta, Alcantara, Avella, Bailey, Breslin, Brooks, Carlucci, Comrie, Dilan, Gianaris, Hamilton, Hoylman, Kaminsky, Kavanagh, Klein, Krueger, Montgomery, Persaud, Rithchie, Sanders, Savino. Sepulveda, Serrano, Stavisky, Valesky , S.6046-C, and Assembly Members  Glick, Vanel, Ortiz, DenDekker, Cymbrowitz, Quart, Barron, Williams, Hevesi, Simon, Thiele, L. Rosenthal, Cook, Gottfried, Rodriguez, D’Urso, Carroll, Blake, De La Rosa, Dinowitz, Dickens, Seawright, Jaffee, Mosley, Aubry, Bichotte, Kim, Rivera, Simotas, Pichardo, Rozic, Benedetto, Titus, Pellegrino, Paulin, Taylor, Arroyo, Espinal, et al., A.7798-C, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and the general municipal law relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York, in  relation to making technical corrections thereto; and to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million or more a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the NYC. (S.6046-C/A.7798-C)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Savino, S.8497, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10696, “AN  ACT  to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to amending the contribution provisions applicable to  certain  New  York City  Employees' Retirement  System (NYCERS) Special Plans subject to Retirement and Social Security Law (RSSL) Articles 14 and 15 to allow using any excess basic or additional member contributions to offset any deficits in such other contribution account  prior  to  date  of retirement”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amending the contribution provisions applicable to certain New York City Employees’ Retirement System (NYCERS) Special Plans subject to Retirement and Social Security Law (RSSL) Articles 14 and 15.  (A.10696/ S. 8497)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Holyman and Golden, S.7780, and Assembly Member Gottfried, A.9943, “AN ACT relating to granting retroactive eligibility to apply for enhanced Tier 3 status to former New York City police officer Mark Rivera”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Granting retroactive eligibility to apply for enhanced Tier 3 status to former New York City police officer Mark Rivera. (S.7780/ A.9943)

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting held on June 7, 2018.
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Application No. C 180088 ZMX submitted by Markland 745 LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 6b, changing from an M1-2 District to an M1-2/R6A District, changing from an M1-2 District to an M1-4/R7D District, changing from an M1-2/R6A District to an M1-4/R7D District, and establishing a Special Mixed Use District (MX-1), on property in the vicinity of Willow Avenue and East 133rd Street, Borough of the Bronx, Community District 1, Council District 17.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application No. N 180089 ZRX submitted by Markland 445 LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying Article XII, Chapter 3 (Special Mixed Use District) and modifying Appendix F for the purpose of establishing a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing area, Borough of the Bronx, Community District 1, Council District 17.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motions, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
